job_description: R&D Engineer - job post Endress+Hauser Optical Analysis 11027 Arrow Rte, Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730 $75,000 - $112,000 a year -  Full-time, Temporary You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $75,000 - $112,000 a year Job Type Full-time Temporary Role + Responsibilities The R&D Engineer is responsible for identifying, generating, designing and validating scientifically-based new product concepts which will satisfy customers’ requirements for the measurement of trace gases in various petrochemical applications and lead to products with clear, demonstrable, and sustainable competitive advantages. Major Responsibilities: Develop, improve, implement and test chemometrics or other spectra analysis algorithms to Support analyzer and/or application development needs Model and correct hardware defects Diagnose spectroscopy health Identify and mitigate system noises Explore full potential and solve existing issues of wavelength modulation spectroscopy Reduce impact from external disturbances and improve analyzer robustness Perform design of experiments (DOE) and hands-on spectroscopy experiments to collect spectra data from benchtop setups and/or prototype analyzers Use the outcome of chemometric modeling or other spectra analysis algorithms to guide the development & design of analyzer hardware & software. Document algorithms in math equations and scientific languages Report outcome and test results in context of spectroscopy, application and product development Provide spectra analysis and analyzer troubleshooting supports to manufacturing, field service, and sales & marketing teams. Other Duties: Researching, generating, and designing new methods and algorithms, and proving concept feasibility of systems for measuring trace gases in the natural gas and petrochemical applications by: Predominantly using laser-based gas absorption spectroscopic technologies Following management’s general direction and incorporating inputs from marketing team Leveraging technology advancements in lasers, spectroscopy, opto-electronics, photonics and gas sensing Validating designs by conducting laser spectroscopy experiments and/or numerical simulations Documenting the validated R&D concepts and experimental/simulation validation results Transferring the validated R&D concepts to the engineering development & manufacturing engineering teams and supporting their efforts to bring the concept to the point of a released product Assisting manufacturing in testing, optimizing and certifying new analyzers to be shipped to customers. Generating invention disclosures and assisting in patent applications Qualification + Profile Qualifications: A minimum of Bachelor’s degree in Physics, Engineering, Chemistry, Math, Computer Science, Data Science. Masters or PhD in these fields is preferred. A minimum of 2 years’ hands-on experiences in laboratory experimentation, spectroscopy instrumentation, optics, electronics, data acquisition and processing A minimum of 2 years’ experience in quantitative data analysis in areas such as chemistry, physics, mathematics, statistics, computer science, and spectral analysis A minimum of 2 years’ experience in developing chemometric models or other spectra analysis algorithms using lab or field data Coding skills in Python and/or Labview Experience in Artificial Intelligence methods such as Neural Network and Machine Learning is preferred. Good understanding of spectroscopic methods, especially laser absorption spectroscopy, NIR and NDIR is preferred Excellent mathematical skills Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Must be able to work and communicate rapidly, effectively and efficiently in multi-disciplinary teams; this includes all levels within industrial environment, including internal staff, vendors, customers and management Must have excellent work ethic, with the ability to work independently on assigned tasks, collaborate effectively on team projects, with a proactive approach to achieve goals Must be adaptable to work on a variety of assignments simultaneously, supporting a dynamic organization Benefits + Perks The security of working for an international family-owned company Competitive compensation and bonus opportunities Comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental and vision insurance Generous paid time off, including company paid holidays and volunteer time off Company paid life insurance and 401(k) with company match Health Savings Account (HSA) with company match Tuition reimbursement and a wide range of development opportunities Salary Range $75,000 - $112,000 annual salary + bonus Contact us + Apply If this position is of interest to you, please apply via the link. We look forward to hearing from you!
